alert.note: Alert for Iron; Reynolds (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 03 at 4:36AM CDT until July 03 at 6:45AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...THE FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 AM CDT FOR SOUTHERN IRON AND REYNOLDS COUNTIES... At 433 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area are begining to diminish, so little additional accumulation is expected. However, up to five inches of rain has already fallen, thus flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. Some locations that will experience flooding include... Reynolds, Ellington, Bunker, Annapolis, Glover, Oates, Centerville, Corridon, Redford, Hogan, Black, Sabula, Chloride and Lesterville. This also includes Johnsons Shut-Ins State Park and Taum Sauk Mountain State Park. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of small creeks and streams, country roads, farmland, and other low lying spots.
